title: Cymothoe herminia
text:
Cymothoe herminia, the Herminia glider, is a <a href="butterfly">butterfly</a> in the family <a href="Nymphalidae">Nymphalidae</a>. It is found in <a href="Sierra%20Leone">Sierra Leone</a>, <a href="Liberia">Liberia</a>, <a href="Ivory%20Coast">Ivory Coast</a>, <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>, <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>, <a href="Equatorial%20Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a>, the <a href="Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Republic of the Congo</a>, the <a href="Central%20African%20Republic">Central African Republic</a>, the <a href="Democratic%20Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Democratic Republic of the Congo</a>, <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>, <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>, <a href="Tanzania">Tanzania</a> and <a href="Zambia">Zambia</a>. The habitat consists of lowland to submontane forests.
Adults are attracted to fermented fruit.
The larvae feed on "<a href="Dovyalis">Dovyalis</a>", "<a href="Rawsonia">Rawsonia</a>" and "<a href="Dasylepis%20%28plant%29">Dasylepis</a>" species.
